newsitem.title: USA: MS-NBC's new business news services.
newsitem.headline: MS-NBC's new business news services.

text.p: MS-NBC, the joint venture between NBC, a unit of General Electric Co and Microsoft Corp, said its new business news service, MS-NBC Business Video, would feature breaking and archived business news, interviews and analyses from CNBC, North America, Europe and Asia.
MS-NBC Business Video expects to feature roughly 300 CEO interviews each month.
The business video serviced will primarily rely on content from CNBC and its affiliates, although it has 27 journalists working for it exclusively, said a spokeswoman.
Videos, audio and other news will be archived up to 90 days on the service's Internet site.
The service will use a variety of Microsoft technologies, including NetShow 2.0 software that enables multicaste live video to be broadcast over the Internet to corporate intranets.
A spokesman for MS-NBC Business Video said the service will not use advertising now, but it may come to rely on advertising in the future.
